commit_message:
Reject rules inserted into non persisted policies

This patch rejects rule creation requests that insert rules into
non persisted policies, i.e. datasource policies with error message
"Rules not permitted on non persisted policies".

Change-Id: I35d650a60213a31c090b91b654bb7259b7f03ed0
Closes-bug: 1436151

[{'created': '2015-04-14 18:21:05.000000000', 'files': ['docker/glance/glance-api/start.sh'], 'message': 'remove wait_for from glance-api

For some reason glance sometimes fails to permanently find keystone
while other services do find keystone.  The host also has full access
to keystone.  Change wait_for to fail_unless.

This could be a docker bug, a wait_for bug, or some other problem.

Change-Id: I02d611d65b7ffddb9c27101fd60e2a8b7cc25658
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
remove wait_for from glance-api

For some reason glance sometimes fails to permanently find keystone
while other services do find keystone.  The host also has full access
to keystone.  Change wait_for to fail_unless.

This could be a docker bug, a wait_for bug, or some other problem.

Change-Id: I02d611d65b7ffddb9c27101fd60e2a8b7cc25658

commit_message:
rename keystone_v2_authenticate method

In puppet-neutron, keystone_v2_authenticate already exists and is in
colision with the keystone_v2_authenticate in puppet-heat.

While we move the whole method in puppet-openstacklib, let's just rename
the method from keystone_v2_authenticate to keystone_v2_auth.

Closes-bug #1429096

Change-Id: I15b6d0550bb3baef37d7536d264b822768802ad0

handle_request method with a prefix (module name).

Closes-bug: #1429096

commit_message:
[install-guide] Replace LVMISCSIDriver with LVMVolumeDriver

This solves the following issues:

LVMISCSIDriver is deprecated, you should now just use LVMVolumeDriver
and specify target_helper for the target driver you wish to use.

Also, use a specific backend section for LVM rather than the default
section.

Partially implements bp installguide-kilo.
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>

Change-Id: If2e356553ea699f23a3462d0d73a92b1ab0c6bd6

[{'created': '2015-04-15 00:23:36.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Rename keystoneclient-federation to saml2

Federation is becoming a very core part of keystone's scope. We had
initially split keystoneclient-federation particularly to separate
additional dependencies. It was decided that it is more correct to call
this repository keystoneclient-saml2 as this is what will be there and
we may not want to lump together all federation plugins in one repo.

This library has never had a release so will not have an impact on
users.

Change-Id: Ia25e14a6afa939590ebba3a91973ceee4a8eaee2
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Rename keystoneclient-federation to saml2

Federation is becoming a very core part of keystone's scope. We had
initially split keystoneclient-federation particularly to separate
additional dependencies. It was decided that it is more correct to call
this repository keystoneclient-saml2 as this is what will be there and
we may not want to lump together all federation plugins in one repo.

This library has never had a release so will not have an impact on
users.

Change-Id: Ia25e14a6afa939590ebba3a91973ceee4a8eaee2

commit_message:
Adding nova creating and deleting for client

This is a way to create and delete nova instances leveraging an LWRP and
the fog gem.

This is just a POC on how to do it; but i think with this we can cargo
cult a lot of code to get all of fog supported.

Change-Id: I6ba402611d3f4a05470a01eed9c99abcb002045f

subject: Modify openrc variables for broken clients
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-17 13:52:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Modify openrc variables for broken clients

Enabling the newer versions of APIs for clients
requires different environment variables in openrc
files. For example:

1) With keystone API version 3, the glance client still
   expects OS_TENANT_NAME instead of OS_PROJECT_NAME.
   Version 0.16 apparently fixed this issue, but Ubuntu
   currently includes 0.15.

2) With glance API version 2, the glance client requires
   OS_IMAGE_API_VERSION=2 instead of using version 2
   by default if returned in the list of available API
   versions. Impacts all versions.

3) With keystone API version 3, the cinder client still
   expects OS_TENANT_NAME instead of OS_PROJECT_NAME.
   Impacts all versions.

4) With keystone API version 3, the swift client still
   expects a versioned endpoint and the "-V 3" command-line
   option. Best I can tell, it does not support environment
   variables for API version. Luckily, the other clients
   seem to work with a versioned endpoint, so we can
   configure it globally, at least for now.

I suspect some of these issues originate from distributions
packaging older versions of the clients and expect more
changes to these variables as we continue testing of
Kilo. I suggest we make these changes in the particular
service chapters to keep better track of them.

Change-Id: I617e3eaf86bbd33e859930baaa1e5cb4bb5850f0
Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo

commit_message:
Modify openrc variables for broken clients

Enabling the newer versions of APIs for clients
requires different environment variables in openrc
files. For example:

1) With keystone API version 3, the glance client still
   expects OS_TENANT_NAME instead of OS_PROJECT_NAME.
   Version 0.16 apparently fixed this issue, but Ubuntu
   currently includes 0.15.

2) With glance API version 2, the glance client requires
   OS_IMAGE_API_VERSION=2 instead of using version 2
   by default if returned in the list of available API
   versions. Impacts all versions.

3) With keystone API version 3, the cinder client still
   expects OS_TENANT_NAME instead of OS_PROJECT_NAME.
   Impacts all versions.

4) With keystone API version 3, the swift client still
   expects a versioned endpoint and the "-V 3" command-line
   option. Best I can tell, it does not support environment
   variables for API version. Luckily, the other clients
   seem to work with a versioned endpoint, so we can
   configure it globally, at least for now.

5) With cinder API version 2, the cinder client requires
   OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION=2 instead of using version 2
   by default if returned in the list of available API
   versions. Impacts all versions.

I suspect some of these issues originate from distributions
packaging older versions of the clients and expect more
changes to these variables as we continue testing of
Kilo. I suggest we make these changes in the particular
service chapters to keep better track of them.

Change-Id: I617e3eaf86bbd33e859930baaa1e5cb4bb5850f0
Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo

commit_message:
Add coe attribute to BayModel

Add the Core Orchestration Engine (coe) attribute to the BayModel API, model, and DB objects to be used by the Heat Conductor Handler when creating a Bay.
1) Add coe attribute to BayModel models
2) Use coe attribute in heat handler's get_template_definition(...) calls

Partially implements https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/multiple-bay-templates

Change-Id: I3383f6efa3f8839b8f0735ea022307a2d9549d65

[{'created': '2015-04-14 18:49:56.000000000', 'files': ['reference/new-projects-requirements.rst'], 'message': 'Let projects add repos without prior-approval

Some OpenStack projects are adding git repos at a moderate pace
and generally the TC is rubber-stamping them as long as the PTL
approves.  Explicitly codify that this is desirable -- the TC
doesn't really care how many git repos it takes to accomplish a
task, so as long as a new repo fits within the existing mission
statement, indicate that it is permissible to add it without
prior TC approval.

This is not strictly a "new project requirement", however, this
document seems to be the best existing place to add it as it
relates to project creation.

Change-Id: I34acfe4ffe5a0af6a941e70a5315a07d036e6c24
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Let projects add repos without prior-approval

Some OpenStack projects are adding git repos at a moderate pace
and generally the TC is rubber-stamping them as long as the PTL
approves.  Explicitly codify that this is desirable -- the TC
doesn't really care how many git repos it takes to accomplish a
task, so as long as a new repo fits within the existing mission
statement, indicate that it is permissible to add it without
prior TC approval.

This is not strictly a "new project requirement", however, this
document seems to be the best existing place to add it as it
relates to project creation.

Change-Id: I34acfe4ffe5a0af6a941e70a5315a07d036e6c24

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-09 15:19:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adding the Puppet modules to OpenStack

The Puppet modules for OpenStack bring scalable and reliable IT
automation to OpenStack cloud deployments.
They enable system administrators to automate any lifecycle stage
of their OpenStack infrastructure.

The code base has existed for more than 3 years in the stackforge code
namespace. The contributors come from various companies including Puppet Labs,
Red Hat, iWeb, Time Warner Cable, Aptira, Mirantis and more.

Our meetings are weekly, on IRC, and our roadmap is transparent and
managed on Launchpad again using standard OpenStack community practices
[1].

Our group wanted to elect and only one (me) applied [2] so we have a
PTL of this project.

This patch is an official request to be part of the big tent and become
an official project.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Puppet
[2] https://www.mail-archive.com/openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org/msg49290.html

Change-Id: Ic6257647916e8fabf9f7032f2db2415696078ce7

commit_message:
Adding the Puppet modules to OpenStack

The Puppet modules for OpenStack bring scalable and reliable IT
automation to OpenStack cloud deployments.
They enable system administrators to automate any lifecycle stage
of their OpenStack infrastructure.

The code base has existed for more than 3 years in the stackforge code
namespace. The contributors come from various companies including Puppet Labs,
Red Hat, iWeb, Time Warner Cable, Aptira, Mirantis and more.

Our meetings are weekly, on IRC, and our roadmap is transparent and
managed on Launchpad again using standard OpenStack community practices
[1].

Our group wanted to elect and only one (me) applied [2] so we have a
PTL of this project.

This patch is an official request to be part of the big tent and become
an official project.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Puppet
[2] https://www.mail-archive.com/openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org/msg49290.html

Change-Id: Ic6257647916e8fabf9f7032f2db2415696078ce7

commit_message:
Pin puppetlabs-concat to 1.2.1 in fixtures

Puppet Labs is in the process of releasing a 2.0.0 version of
puppetlabs-concat, which will have many breaking changes that affect
many dependent modules. Changes have been merged to master, but not yet
released. While we figure out what changes we need to make in our own
modules and wait for updates in dependent modules, we should just pin
to a stable version.

Change-Id: I8a3a0ef54ffeb55cf59ba8f9b79340d64065c905

commit_message:
Pin puppetlabs-concat to 1.2.1 in fixtures

Puppet Labs is in the process of releasing a 2.0.0 version of
puppetlabs-concat, which will have many breaking changes that affect
many dependent modules. Changes have been merged to master, but not yet
released. While we figure out what changes we need to make in our own
modules and wait for updates in dependent modules, we should just pin
to a stable version.

Change-Id: I27378d246892e2bb67b89d2b1d50fe957b3eedb5

commit_message:
WIP: Fixes errors in Neutron Linux Bridge Agent

Previously, the linuxbridge agent was not loading it's config
file. This PS adds --config-file flags to the lb-agent process
The PS also adds the iproute package needed for the vxlan plugin
and removes the unnecessary soft link.

Partially Implements: Container set compute-operation-neutron

Change-Id: I1d7798acbb3b07763b731343aa31c42b6a699ef1

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-09 10:20:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adding MagnetoDB to OpenStack

MagnetoDB is a key-value store service for OpenStack. It provides horizontally
scalable, queryable storage, accessible via REST API.

MagnetoDB has been designed and developed in order to provide:

 - Easy integration: REST API. Support Amazon DynamoDB API
 - OpenStack interoperability: integrated with Keystone. Follows OpenStack
   design tenets, packaging and distribution
 - Database pluggability: supports Cassandra, any other databases could
   be easily added
 - Horizontal scalability: MagnetoDB is scalable lineary by amount of
   data and requests
 - High availability: just one working API node is enough to continue
   handling requests

Ilya Sviridov was choosen as PTL via elections.

MagnetoDB team has bi-weekly IRC meetings, uses Launchpad, openstack-dev mail
list,  spec repo for issue, roadmap traking and communication publicly.

MagnetoDB employs OpenStack Tempest for functional testing running within
gates on community resources.

OpenStack Keystone is used for authentification.

commit_message:
Adding MagnetoDB to OpenStack

MagnetoDB is a key-value store service for OpenStack. It provides horizontally
scalable, queryable storage, accessible via REST API.

MagnetoDB has been designed and developed in order to provide:

 - Easy integration: REST API. Support Amazon DynamoDB API
 - OpenStack interoperability: integrated with Keystone. Follows OpenStack
   design tenets, packaging and distribution
 - Database pluggability: supports Cassandra, any other databases could
   be easily added
 - Horizontal scalability: MagnetoDB is scalable lineary by amount of
   data and requests
 - High availability: just one working API node is enough to continue
   handling requests

Ilya Sviridov was choosen as PTL via elections.

MagnetoDB team has bi-weekly IRC meetings, uses Launchpad, openstack-dev mail
list,  spec repo for issue, roadmap traking and communication publicly.

MagnetoDB employs OpenStack Tempest for functional testing running within
gates on community resources.

OpenStack Keystone is used for authentification.

MagnetoDB sends usage data to OpenStack Ceilometer.

Change-Id: I46172d745ffc12df14cd3697c9ce4dcad0602a1f

commit_message:
Add test for user_cache

Since we intend to invalidate the user_cache, and properties and caching
decorators don't play nicely, we split this into the property and a
getter which can be called explicitly.

Note that this test also uncovered a bug in user_cache, which was that
it called a non-existent task.

Change-Id: Ica04a82242cf4724155f99de5b8d3d9c356a8ec4

commit_message:
MonkeyPatch time.sleep in unit tests to avoid wait

There's no need to wait real world seconds when there are no real
world servers at the other end of these API calls. We still do wait a
little bit of time, in case there is some reliance on actually having
called the real time.sleep, but this should feed up test running in
a loop quite a bit.

Also lowering timeout on rebuild_server as it unnecessarily sleeps
for 1 second.

Change-Id: Ic26e90af12aedbedfbe0cc468332b921516a8409

commit_message:
Update README to work with release tools

The README file needs to have links to the project documentation and bug
tracker in a parsable format in order for some of the release tools
scripts to work (particularly the one that prints the release note
email).

commit_message:
neutron: reduce complexity of allocate_for_instance (security_groups)

This pulls the security_group filtering loop out of
allocate_for_instance and into it's own private helper method.

Adds more documentation and cleans up the code a bit for readability.

Change-Id: I120b59d5d883ea58ead9a0ff70962a99b9881299

commit_message:
TOSCA: organize test templates

The test templates has two different locations, there is no overlapping but
it makes sense to have them all to a common place for easy reference.

Change-Id: I37badc8fb2fa6ae8286d0007a229ee76e8fb1986

commit_message:
Add /usr/local/bin in exec_dirs

Devstack installs some of the neutron utilities into /usr/local/bin.
In stead of adding individual filters to allow them to run from that
directory, this patch adds /usr/local/bin into exec_dirs.

A followup patch will remove local filters for metadata_proxy

Closes-Bug: 1435971
Change-Id: I3abd1c173121dc8abb5738d1879db8ac9a98b690

commit_message:
Release Import of Translations from Transifex

Manual import of Translations from Transifex. This change also removes
all po files that are less than 66 per cent translated since such
partially translated files will not help users.

This updates also recreates all pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle the proposed branches and we need to sync with latest
translations.

Change-Id: Ifa211a8bd8d18d9b9b97bce8610587c829b94324

commit_message:
Temporarily ignore requirements on master libs

We need to disable checks of master branch requirements in libraries
so we can release updated versions of all libs that have no capped
requirements. We can restore the checks when that is done, and then
we'll look into ways to update the tools to not update caps on
library projects.

http://logs.openstack.org/32/174532/1/check/gate-python-heatclient-requirements/ba4c6dd/console.html#_2015-04-16_19_03_49_535

Change-Id: I4e4ac0580b9a1a98cc5cc9ba62d6977324a15296

commit_message:
Add console access origin validation

The configuration of console proxy can fail easily if not properly
configured, this change attempts to explain origin validation
errors.

This also fix a bad link.

The sahara-tox-py27-scenario-unit job should be voting since kilo

This jobs already working ok for some some time as non-voting check job
and now we're ready to enable it as voting for branches starts with kilo.

stable/juno where this tests were not yet implemented.

commit_message:
Remove concatenation in csv file

The download CSV summary file from both the Admin and Project
overview pages includes concatenation in its contents.
The : needs to be included as part of the label so translators
have control of spacing. Note that the commas are part of the
CSV file format and should not be translated.

Change-Id: I13137fda9b3e93edf97a7539044e791d04017ea7
Closes-Bug: 1444135

commit_message:
[install-guide] Remove use_namespaces option

In the l3_agent.ini and dhcp_agent.ini files, remove the
deprecated use_namespaces option because minimum Linux
kernel versions support namespaces. Option defaults to
"true" until removal of the option in Liberty.

Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo
Change-Id: I8013c468d9fd9834b769bf24998c2214e7106e83

subject: Suppress nagios_wrapper valueMeta for empty detail
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-17 21:59:07.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/nagios_wrapper.py'], 'message': 'Suppress nagios_wrapper valueMeta for empty detail

Checks processed by the nagios_wrapper typically contain a text string
and return code.  The text string is submitted to the API as valueMeta
'detail'.  However, if the Nagios check does not return a text string,
the 'detail' field is empty, this condition has been known to cause an
UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY error in the API ("valueMeta detail cannot have an
empty value").

This change prevents valueMeta 'detail' from being submitted to the API
if the Nagios check outputs no text string along with its return code.

Change-Id: Ic6b584d6f988323d25676ebbdbdbe3edd06c4c3a
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Suppress nagios_wrapper valueMeta for empty detail

Checks processed by the nagios_wrapper typically contain a text string
and return code.  The text string is submitted to the API as valueMeta
'detail'.  However, if the Nagios check does not return a text string,
the 'detail' field is empty, this condition has been known to cause an
UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY error in the API ("valueMeta detail cannot have an
empty value").

This change prevents valueMeta 'detail' from being submitted to the API
if the Nagios check outputs no text string along with its return code.

Change-Id: Ic6b584d6f988323d25676ebbdbdbe3edd06c4c3a

subject: Adds support for container selection for backup
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-21 16:49:43.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/volume/v1/backup.py'], 'message': 'Adds support for container selection for backup

Changed argument from parsed_args.volume to parsed_args.container as per what
is expected in python-cinderclient.

If not defined, defaults to "backup_swift_container" in cinder.conf.

Stops there being a container for every volume you take backups off.

Change-Id: I4a34894222f71b0f207d007c32427040589406aa
Closes-Bug: 1446751
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Adds support for container selection for backup

Changed argument from parsed_args.volume to parsed_args.container as per what
is expected in python-cinderclient.

If not defined, defaults to "backup_swift_container" in cinder.conf.

Stops there being a container for every volume you take backups off.

Change-Id: I4a34894222f71b0f207d007c32427040589406aa
Closes-Bug: 1446751

commit_message:
Publish to /draft/ instead of /trunk

Publish Install Guide to docs.openstack.org/draft/install-guide

Publish Networking Guide to docs.openstack.org/draft/networking-guide
Publish Configuration Reference to /draft as well.

Update link /trunk/index.html

Partial implements bp draft-publishing

Change-Id: I620339c45e07bc492328f8df908e7b9f5f5ef9fa

commit_message:
Remove obsolete tables

In previous changes, configuration options have been removed from
flagmappings and thus a few table are now completely obsolete.

Remove these tables and update the flagmappings header.

Change-Id: I08b8f92a679a572eeb64d5dbe111e7e693da3914

commit_message:
Remove XenAPINFS driver

With change I2123b2d52180bbdffe90c458f115c67f50dfd5e9 the driver was
removed from cinder, remove it from our documents as well.

This removes also the obsolete table cinder-storage_xen.xml.

Related-Bug: #1372836
Change-Id: Iffff1f5cd21ae7ed09da7f9923e1d4c99f876d43
